executive_summary: Swelling awareness of the importance of substance abuse treatment has supported drug and alcohol rehabilitation clinics in recent years. Medicare and Medicaid coverage expansion and program funding through SAMHSA have aligned with the changing societal attitudes toward drug and alcohol abuse. The expansion of clinics has been vital, as strengthening rates of substance abuse and a worsening opioid epidemic boost the need for accessible treatment. COVID-19 exacerbated preexisting rates of substance abuse in the US. Long periods of stress and isolation pushed many people to drugs and alcohol to cope, while the CDC is attributing the swelling use of fentanyl to an unprecedented overdose death rate. Pandemic-related operating and labor challenges have strained clinics' ability to meet the record-high demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Efforts to Destigmatize Substance Abuse Lead More Patients to Treatment
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Swelling awareness of the importance of substance abuse treatment has supported drug and alcohol rehabilitation clinics, as waning stigma encourages more people to look for care. Medicare and Medicaid's coverage expansion and more significant funding through the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Administration (SAMHSA) has aligned with the changing societal attitudes toward drug and alcohol abuse, strengthening access to care. Despite this, strengthening incomes, broader insurance coverage and changing attitudes have led industry-wide revenue to expand at a CAGR of 3.3% over the past five years, totaling an estimated $5.3 billion in 2024, when revenue is slated to expand 2.2%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Workforce shortages and consolidation activity are the key trends
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Workforce shortages and consolidation activity are the key trends in drug and alcohol rehabilitation clinics. Population expansion, COVID-related stressors, low reimbursement rates and external employment trends are factors behind shortages. Hiring challenges constrain profit expansion, as wages have swelled alongside revenue to attract and retain staff. Consolidation activity has reached record levels, as a highly fragmented, favorable insurance coverage and growing demand present massive opportunities.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Elevated Substance Abuse Rates Will Keep Demand for Clinics at a Record High
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Drug and alcohol rehabilitation clinics will continue to see an uptick in demand from patients seeking treatment. A combination of long-lasting pandemic effects, societal factors, mental health considerations and the chronic nature of addiction indicate that demand for clinics will remain at a record high. Drug and alcohol rehabilitation clinics haven't been able to keep pace with the need. This will pour over into clinics moving forward, as long waiting periods and pent-up demand keep the number of people seeking care high.

industry_definition: Drug and alcohol rehabilitation clinics are specialized medical and therapeutic facilities designed to help individuals overcome substance abuse and addiction through various services on an outpatient or inpatient basis.

opportunities: Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid
threats: Number of people with private health insurance

key_trends: Clinics with established histories of successful outcomes are the most competitive. Patients and their family members seek out clinics where chances of rehabilitation are highest.

Substance abuse treatment is an essential health benefit, but coverage limitations make affordability an important consideration. Patients will visit clinics where the balance of quality and out-of-pocket costs is best.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Medicaid is the single largest payer of drug and alcohol rehabilitation services in the US.

products_and_services.product_description: Treatment aimed exclusively at individuals with alcohol use dependency.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid and reimbursement levels impact the affordability of drug and alcohol rehabilitation clinics.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of rehabilitation clinics, around 35%, while its population percentage is around 25%. This indicates that the Southeast has a higher concentration of rehabilitation clinics compared to its population share.

regulations_points.regulation_title: HEALTH INSURANCE PORTABILITY AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT
regulations_points.regulation_description: Rehabilitation clinics must follow all of the criteria of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA). HIPAA outlines controls for patient health data for any healthcare provider that stores, shares or sends private patient data.
